intro: Nolana cerrateana, commonly known as the Chilean starflower, is a flowering plant native to Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Nolana cerrateana is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
